text: My People Were Fair and Had Sky in Their Hair... But Now They're Content to Wear Stars on Their Brows is the first album by Tyrannosaurus Rex (later named T. Rex). T. Rex was a psychedelic folk band. It was released on 5 July 1965. It was released by Regal Zonophone (a record label). == Release == The album went to number 15 on the UK Album Chart when it was released. In 1972, it was released as a double album. The other album on the double album was Prophets, Seers & Sages: The Angels of the Ages (1968). The double album went to number one on the UK Album Chart. The double album has the longest name of any album to go to number one in the UK. The album was released again in 1985, 2004 and 2015. == Track listing == == References == Category:1968 albums
title:
My People Were Fair and Had Sky in Their Hair... But Now They're Content to
Wear Stars on Their Brows
